newsitem.title: UK: NWE high sulphur barges soften, cargo market quiet.
newsitem.headline: NWE high sulphur barges soften, cargo market quiet.

text.p: NWE fuel oil prices softened slightly on Tuesday in a market slow to recover from the Easter doldrums, traders said.
High sulphur barges traded at $85 and $86 fob ARA with bunker demand very thin. But dealers said interest picked up later with offers back at $86 fob.
"We'll just have to wait and see which way the market goes this afternoon," said one.
Cargoes were very quiet. Refiners faced with poor fuel oil demand were comforted that crude's continuing weakness will help margins to recover further, despite soft prices for product.
But good weather across Europe and weak industrial power requirements in Italy have worsened the demand picture for the medium term, traders noted.
